habitat_description:
Northwest:
This species prefers moist coniferous forest of Douglas fir, mixed confier, and redwoods in the Klamath, Siskiyou and North Coast ranges of northern California and southwest Oregon and north to Deschutes County. They are active in around downed logs on the forest floor of ceanothus bush in Sitka spruce, incense cedar, and white and red fir habitats. They occur mostly at elevations between 1000 - 1200 meters but range from sea level to as high as 2000 meters (Johnson 1943, Zeiner et al. 1990, Wilson and Ruff 1999, Verts and Carraway 1998). They are also found in open, rocky, and chapparal-covered habitats (Wilson and Ruff 1999).
